reviewText: Excellent.  Video and audio is very good.  Great film noir.  Each story is different and keeps your attention to the very end to see what happens.  In the Hitchcock genre.

These movies, the ones starring Richard Dix, bring unexpected and unforeseen solutions.  They keep me on the edge of my seat.  I have not watched the dvd set yet, but I bought the movies because I have already seen them all and I find them fascinating.

First of all please note that the 4 disks are home made DVD-R format.  My mistake was reading all the info on the left side and not seeing that someone had posted at the top of their ad that there were in fact home made DVD-Rs.  I have probably one of the first Sony DVD players and it plays all the factory pressed DVD's just fine.  These DVD-R's became pixelated, or large video blocks and eventually they just locked up in my player.

So, after a trip to a friend's house he was able to play them on his flat screen monitor and that's when you can see that they're all very grainy and looked like they were copied off of a VHS or Beta tape.  Also, we noticed at the bottom right hand corner a large logo would pop up from time to time and my friend mentioned these were probably laid over to cover up another logo like TCM, or whatever station was airing them at the time they were copied.

Finally, one more gripe.  The so called MP3 CD that is supposed to contain a collection of Whistler Radio Shows was another HUGE disappointment!!!  Instead of The Whistler it was filled with Ronald Regan Speeches!

My suggestion, save your money and wait until Columbia Studios actually digs into their vaults and releases the original prints in a quality befitting DVD.

I have seen all of the films and i can say that they are  excellent.
People who love film noir should should check these out as they are very good.

Been a fan of TW for years.  There are 8 shows in 4 CDs. Visual  and audial quality are pretty good. The seller also threw in a Whistler on radio cd containing 78 mp3 files. Great for listening at night. If you are a fan of TW or Richard Dix, these are for you.

The Whistler is in my opinion is one of the best radio shows.  At this time I have not listened to all of these.  I also like the movies,
they probably not considered cinema classics, I Like them.
Chris.

This is a top of the line dvd set.  I have looked for this for years, and this was the first that I could find it, so I snatched it up.  If you like the Whistler, you will love this set.  Picture and Audio quality are excellent!

Man, if you like the good ol' stuff, snap this up. All eight Whistler movies from the 1940s, including the four directed by William Castle, plus 230 hours worth of Whistler radio programs. This is a collection to enjoy for the rest of your life.
These were good quality, fun movies on a par with Universal's Inner Sanctum Mystery series. Several were even better than the more well-known Lon Chaney films.

OnesMedia is selling these films at a very nice price. Eight films on four DVD-Rs for $25. Picture quality ranges from OK to pretty good, but OnesMedia did a heroic job of cleaning up the sound. No subtitles, but I wasn't expecting any at this price. These are DVD-Rs, but I had no problem playing them. The Whistler is not really a B-Movie Detective. He's a mysterious character in a black cape who prowls in the shadows and narrates this series of B-Movies produced between 1944 and 1948. An observer of crime. Richard Dix starred in seven of the eight films, before ill-health forced him to retire. Dix didn't play the actual Whistler - the Whistler is anonymous and mysterious. Based on a popular radio show, samples of which are included on a bonus mp3. Since I wrote this review, "Choice Collection" has issued these films on eight DVD-Rs for $15 each. That works out to Eight films on eight DVD-Rs for $120 vs Eight films on four DVD-Rs for $25 on OnesMedia.. I haven't seen the "Choice Collection" DVD-Rs so I am not qualified to comment on them, other than to point out that they are rather pricey. Also, in my experience DVD-Rs do not have subtitles This statement is based on experience - Warner Archive Collection DVD-Rs do not have subtitles, even though many of the same films do when shown on TCM ---------------------------------------------------------------- GUIDE TO B-MOVIE DETECTIVES ON DVD A-Movies had bigger budgets and stars, and were top-billed in a double-feature. B-Movies occupied the bottom of the program. Some of the longer-lasting series started out as A-Movies, but ended up as B-Movies (Philo Vance began at Paramount and ended up at PRC) PART ONE: REFORMED CRIMINALS TURNED PRIVATE EYE - Boston Blackie, the Lone Wolf and the Saint are reformed jewel thieves. Still viewed with suspicion by the police. - The Falcon has a shady past (never quite explained). - Arsene Lupin is an unreformed jewel thief who sometimes helps the police if it serves his ends. - The Crime Doctor used to be an Organized Crime Boss. He never actually reformed, but was conked over the head and woke up with amnesia. [hint: for ease of navigation, read the review though to the end, then come back and click on the links. If there is ever a problem with a OnesMedia link, go directly to their website - see my comment dated July 8, 2015] BOSTON BLACKIE: BOSTON BLACKIE FILM COLLECTION - 14 MOVIES - 7 DVD-R CRIME DOCTOR: Cut and paste in the Amazon search bar: * ASIN:B00T83TLTQ THE FALCON: --- George Sanders: The Falcon Mystery Movie Collection, Volume 1 (3 Discs) --- Tom Conway: The Falcon Mystery Movie Collection, Volume 2 THE LONE WOLF: THE LONE WOLF FILM COLLECTION - 15 MOVIES - 8 DVD-R THE SAINT: --- George Sanders: The George Sanders Saint Movie Collection (2 Disc) --- Hugh Sinclair: The Saint's Vacation / The Saint Meets the Tiger: The Saint Double Feature ARSENE LUPIN: Copy and paste in the Amazon Search Bar: * ASIN: B00KB49ME0 ----------------------------------------------------- PART TWO: PRIVATE EYES WITHOUT A CRIMINAL PAST Perry Mason is a also a lawyer, but we'll overlook that. BULLDOG DRUMMOND: --- 10 films, 1929-1938: BULLDOG DRUMMOND Volume 1 - 7 DVD-R - 10 FILMS ---- 8 films, 1939-1951: Not yet released. NICK CARTER: Copy and paste in the Amazon Search Bar: * ASIN: B00CDV4OEC PERRY MASON: Perry Mason Mysteries: The Original Warner Bros. Movies Collection [Warren William starred in 4 of the 6 films.] MICHAEL SHAYNE: Volume One was issued way back in 2007. Still waiting for Volume Two. Copy and paste in the Amazon Search Bar: * ASIN: B000LC4ZDK PHILO VANCE: --- 7 films, 1929-1947: PHILO VANCE FILM RARITIES COLLECTION - 7 DVD-R - 7 MOVIES (OnesMedia) --- 6 films, 1930-1940: The Philo Vance Murder Case Collection (Warner Archive) You need both for a complete collection - there is no overlap. I LOVE A MYSTERY Three films, 1945-1946 starring Jim Bannon and Barton Yarborough The last but least of the B-Movie Detective series. Copy and paste in the Amazon Search Bar: * ASIN: B010J9O0M0 PHILIP MARLOWE / SAM SPADE These two detectives were the most famous Private Eyes of all time, but they don't really belong on this list. They were A-Movie detectives all the way: - 1931 The Maltese Falcon: Ricardo Cortez as Sam Spade - 1936 Satan Met a Lady: Warren William as Sam Spade - adapted from 'The Maltese Falcon' by Dashiell Hammett - 1941 The Maltese Falcon: Humphrey Bogart as Sam Spade - 1944 Murder, My Sweet: Dick Powell as Philip Marlowe - adapted from 'Farewell, My Lovely' by Raymond Chandler - 1946 The Big Sleep: Humphrey Bogart as Philip Marlowe. - 1947 Lady in the Lake: Robert Montgomery as Philip Marlowe. - 1947 The Brasher Doubloon: George Montgomery as Philip Marlowe - adapted from 'The High Window" by Raymond Chandler But two Philip Marlowe novels were adapted as B-Movies for other detectives: - 1942 Time to Kill (Lloyd Nolan as Michael Shayne) - adaptated from 'The High Window' by Raymond Chandler - 1942 The Falcon Takes Over (George Sanders as The Falcon)) - adapted from 'Farewell My Lovely' by Raymond Chandler -------------------------------------------------------- For PART THREE: UNCONVENTIONAL B-MOVIE DETECTIVES from the '30s and '40s, see my Comment dated July 8, 2015. Also directions to the OnesMedia website. * Amazon only permits ten links per review, so I had to use ASIN numbers for the rest (Amazon Stock Index Numbers)

At present I have watched only four of the eight movies.  I cannot access the second movie on each disc, but I believe this is problem with my DVD player rather than with the discs.  One of the four movies I've seen had a few minor defects, brief instances where pixels appeared on the screen.  Otherwise the movies fully matched my expectations.
Pretty  good  audio  and visual.  A  lot  of  radio  programs  on  MP3.  Most  stories  are  well worth  a  watch.

This DVD was also one that I had been looking for a long---- time and use to hear on the radio. So this DVD & CD package was like a precious gift for me to be treasured and kept forever! Thanks Amazon!

What a nice set for Whistler fans. All eight movies AND a cd of the radio shows. This is not a big studio release, but rather a well put together collection by fellow fans wishing to preserve the series. The movies are packaged on four discs (two per disc), each printed in full color and tucked in a nice flip case. The cover art shows the various original movie posters. The cd of radio shows comes in a separate slimline plastic case (not a typical jewel case). The discs all played just fine in my Panasonic Blu-Ray player and there's a simple startup menu to chose which film you want to watch. All-in-all a great set for Whistler fans!
Interesting old movie but did not like the name of the video store popping up on the screen
This is a fine Collection from a great Seller - glad that these Movies are available at a reasonable Price - go and buy and show that Demand for such Gms is real !
Pleasantly pleased with the items!!!!!  Looking forward to my next purchase !!

Love this series, also big richard dix fan, perfect release for me
People who don't like intrusive logos appearing on screen spasmodically will grimace at this though, personally I can live with it !
Gave as a gift and has really been enjoyed. Quality was good as well.
Great seller, quick shipping, and super enjoyable movie collections. As a plus they included a gift. Very thoughtful, thank you.
thses movies are wonderful!

I love this series,  Richard Dix is a great actor, play both good and evil very well.  The direction of Wm.. Castle is great.  I've seen most of these films more than once and will share them with friends.

While some of the films are better than others, a few are absolute masterpieces, and shows that great things can come out of the B units of the major studios. Some reviewers indicate that they were upset by the quality, but for me, this added an atmospheric almost "drive-in" like quality to the effect of the film. Certainly, the prints are not perfect, but unless you want to spend a ton of money buying each film individually, you are getting a great deal. On a medium sized digital T.V., it plays very nicely, and the sound quality is excellent. I've watched three of the four DVD's (6 of the films), and found something to enjoy in all of them. "The Power of the Whistler" is so far the best of the bunch, one I rated a "9" out of "10" on IMDB, and added it to my list of one of the top 100 films of that year.
OLDIES ARE THE BEST
Good movies and comes with radio shows. Some quality issues but they did the best with the original film condition.

The final product is just OK. It's like a good YouTube video. Not polished DVD quality. Maybe I should spring for the "Choice Collection" editions. Great service and shipping. A bonus DVD was included. Too bad I love the series. OK but watchable.
# or 4 movies terrible quality.
Great item. Fast delivery. Quality dvd.

Watched the movies in The Whistler DVDs.  They were OK but not really the type of movies that really appeal to me.  Please let me explain that, they were too human interest for my liking.  Unfortunately I find those types of movies a bit boring.
